overview.title: Data Import/Export
overview.description: Bulk data operations for migration, backup, integration, and reporting
overview.purpose: Move data in and out of the system efficiently while maintaining data integrity

whatIsThis.summary: The Data I/O module provides tools for importing data from external sources and exporting system data for backup, analysis, or integration with other systems.
keyFeatures: Bulk import from Excel, CSV, JSON

whyItMatters.businessValue: Efficient data import saves weeks during implementation. Regular exports provide backup and enable advanced analytics in external tools.
risks: Poor data quality imports cascade errors

import.title: Import
import.description: Bring external data into the system
tips: Always test with small batches first
Use official templates for best results

export.title: Export
export.description: Extract system data for external use
tips: Filter data to keep exports manageable
Include IDs if planning to re-import

history.title: History
tips: Check history when investigating data issues
Keep error reports for troubleshooting patterns

scheduled.title: Scheduled Jobs
tips: Use for regular reporting to stakeholders

staff.restrictions: Cannot import or export team/all data
staff.tips: Use exports for personal productivity tracking

manager.tips: Regular exports help verify data quality

admin.tips: Set up automated backup schedules, document all imports

implementor.tips: Create reusable mapping templates, document transformations

bestPractices: Always test imports with small samples first
Back up data before any import operation
Document field mappings for future reference

warnings.warning: Import operations cannot be easily undone
warnings.mitigation: Always back up before importing, test with small batches
Split files into smaller batches (1000-5000 records)

faqs.question: Can I undo an import?
faqs.answer: Not automatically. You would need to identify and delete imported records manually or restore from backup. This is why testing with small batches is essential.

faqs.question: What's the maximum file size for import?
faqs.answer: 10MB for most file types. For larger datasets, split into multiple files or contact admin for server-side import.

faqs.question: How do I update existing records via import?
faqs.answer: Include the system ID column in your import file. Records with matching IDs will be updated rather than created new.

faqs.question: Why is my import failing validation?
faqs.answer: Check the validation report for specific errors. Common issues: missing required fields, date format mismatches, reference data not found.
